DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate pharmaceutical therapy advance treatment technique infertile patient require in-vitro fertilization utilize donor egg .
DOC.brief_title: Vaginal Progesterone Versus Progesterone Oil Donor Egg Recipient In Vitro Fertilization Cycles Utilizing Vitrified Donor Eggs
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective study evaluate clinical pregnancy rate micronized progesterone ( Endometrin , Ferring Pharmaceuticals ) compare progesterone oil injection in-vitro fertilization ( IVF ) donor egg recipient . The secondary objective evaluate effectiveness freezing/vitrification donor egg . Effectiveness vitrification evaluate egg thaw/survival , fertilization , implantation rate .
DOC.criteria: Oocyte Donors : Age 2134 year age BMI 1834 Normal ovarian reserve , define FSH < 10 AFC > 10 Medical evaluation consistent FDA criterion donor inclusion Donor Oocyte Recipients Documented history infertility require donor oocyte optimal fertility potential Documentation normal uterine cavity hysteroscopy , hysterosonogram , HSG within 1 year study screen Fresh Frozen Sperm Oocyte Donors : Abnormal ovarian reserve , define FSH < 10 , AFC > 10 , prior poor response control ovarian hyperstimulation ( COHS ) Failure meet FDA criterion donor approval ( risk factor medical evaluation ) Previous history poor response COHS Donor Oocyte Recipients : Uncontrolled hypothyroidism , hyperprolactinemia , systemic disease may interfere study treatment Active thrombophlebitis thromboembolic disorder , history hormone associate thrombophlebitis thromboembolic disorder Surgically aspirate sperm ( TESE ) 2 clinical pregnancy loss ( exclude aneuploidy previous autologous cycle ) Clinically significant gynecologic pathology uterine abnormality , submucosal fibroid > 5 cm , communicate hydrosalpinx , uncorrected uterine septum , undiagnosed vaginal bleeding , endometrial atypia , condition could adversely affect pregnancy outcomes History 2 fail IVF donor cycle
